STATEMENT OF
OPERATING CONDITIONS
FOR STORAGE SERVICE
CENTANA INTRASTATE PIPELINE, LLC
Effective
April 1, 2016
CENTANA INTRASTATE PIPELINE, LLC
,
an intrastate pipeline operating within the State of
Texas, will eng
age in the storage of natural gas on the following terms and conditions:
ETariff Information
Tariff Submitter: Centana Intrastate Pipeline
, LLC
FERC Tariff Program name: FERC NGPA Gas Tariff
Tariff Title: CIPCO Storage
SOC
Tariff Record
Proposed Effective Date:
April 1, 2016
Tariff Record Title: Nominations Revised, CIPCO Storage
SOC, 4.1.0
Option Code:
A
Other information:
UNITED STATES OF AMERICA
FEDERAL ENERGY REGULATORY COMMISSION
CENTANA INTRASTATE PIPELINE, LLC
STATEMENT OF OPERATING CONDITIONS
APPLICABLE TO
ALL STORAGE SERVICE
(INCLUDING NGPA SECTION 311 AND TEXAS INTRASTATE SERVICE)

STATEMENT OF EFFECTIVE RATES FOR
311 STORAGE SERVICE
..........................
22
SECTION 1
DEFINITIONS
A.
The term 223Base Gas224 shall mean the gas required to remain in the storage cavern of the
Storage Facility
in order to protect the cavern222s integrity.
B.
The term 223business day224 shall mean any day during a year, except Saturday, Sunday or
Company222s holidays.
C.
The term 223Btu224 shall mean British Therm
al Unit and, where appropriate, the plural thereof,
and the term, 223MMBtu224, shall mean one million (1,000,000) Btu.
D.
The term 223Company224 shall mean Centana Intrastate Pipeline, LLC
E.
The term
223cubic foot224 shall mean the volume
of gas contained in
one (1)
cubi
c foot of space
at a standard
pressure of fourteen and seventy-
three hundredths (14.73)
psia
and a standard
temperature of sixty degrees Fahrenheit
(60260F) under standard gravitational force
. The average
atmospheric pressure shall be assumed to be 11.3 pounds per square inch absolute.
F.
The term 223day224 shall mean a period of twenty
-
four (24) consecutive hours beginning and
ending at 9:00 a.m. Central Clock Time.
G.
The term 223Delivery Point224 shall mean a point located at the Storage Facility.
H.
The term 223Evaluation Period224 shall mean the time period between Company222s receipt of
Shipper222s valid request for firm storage service and Shipper222s execution of a firm
Storage
Agreement
pursuant thereto.
I.
The term 223FERC224 shall mean the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission
.
J.
The term 223firm224 or on a 223firm basis224 means that the capacity in Company222s Storage Facility
necessary to store quantities of gas for the account of Shipper is not now, and will not become, subject to claim by any person other than Shipper.
K.
The term 223fu
el224 means the quantity of gas for Company use, line loss and other unaccounted
for losses in the Storage Facility
.
L.
The term 223gas224 shall mean natural gas as produced in its natural state that meets the quality
standards contained in these general terms.
M.
T
he term 223interruptible224 or on an 223interruptible basis224 means that the storage of gas for the
account of Shipper is subject to the Storage Facility
having sufficient capacity.
1
N.
The term 223Lending
Service224 shall mean the
a
dvance of gas by Company to Customer from
the Storage Facility.
O.
The term 223Maximum Daily Delivery Quantity224 or 223MDDQ224 shall mean the maximum
quantity of gas, expressed in MMBtu, specified in Shipper222s agreement
for Storage Service
that
Shipper may nominate and receive and that Company shall deliver at a delivery point at relatively constant hourly rates of flow over the course of such gas day.
P.
The term 223Maximum Daily Injection Quantity224 or 223MDIQ224, shall mean the maximum
quantity of gas, expressed in MMBtu, specified in Shipper222s agreement for
Storage Service
that
Shipper may nominate and that Company shall receive at the receipt point for injection into storage each gas day at constant hourly rates of flow over the course of such gas day (excluding fuel), as provided for in the Shipper222s Stora
ge Agreement
.
Q.
The term 223Maximum Daily Withdrawal Quantity224 or 223MDWQ224, shall mean the maximum
daily withdrawal quantity of gas, expressed in MMBtu, specified in Shipper222s agreement
for Storage
Service
that Shipper may nominate and that Company shall withdr
aw from storage and tender to
Shipper at delivery point each gas day at constantly hourly rates of flow over the course of such gas day.
R.
The term 223Maximum Storage Quantity224 or 223MSQ224, shall mean the volume of capacity,
expressed in MMBtu, in Company222s faci
lities that Shipper has available for its use pursuant to its
Storage Agreement
with Company.
S.
The term 223Mcf224 shall mean one thousand (1,000) cubic feet of gas.
T.
The term 223month224 shall mean a period beginning on the first (1st) day of the calendar month
an
d extending to the first (1st) day of the following calendar month.
U.
The term 223NGPA224 shall mean the Natural Gas Policy Act of 1978.
V.
The term 223Parking Service224 shall mean the injection of a Customer222s gas into the Storage
Facility.
W.
The term 223Receipt Point
224 shall mean a point located at the Storage Facility.
X.
The term 223Shipper224 shall mean any party that has executed a
Storage Agreement
with
Company for storage service subject to this Statement.
Y.
The term 223Storage Agreement
224 shall mean any contract of Compan
y providing S
torage
,
P
arking or Lending S
ervice to a Shipper.
Z.
The term 223Storage Facility224 means underground natural gas storage caverns and associated
facilities.
2
AA.
The term 223Storage Service224 shall mean the injection, withdrawal and storage of a Customer222s
gas in the Storage Facility.
BB.
The term 223thermally equivalent224 shall mean an equal amount of heating value, expressed in
Btu and measured under the specifications and conditions contained hereunder.
CC.
The term 223Transporter224 shall mean the Shipper222s transpor
ter designated to deliver gas to the
Receipt Point or Shipper222s transporter designated to receive gas from the Delivery Point.
DD.
The term 223Working Gas Inventory224 shall mean the quantity of gas that Shipper has in place
in the Storage Facility
for Shipper222s
Storage Service
account, provided that the Working Gas
Inventory shall never exceed Shipper222s Maximum Storage Quantity.
SECTION 2
RATES
FOR SECTION 311 STORAGE SERVICE
A
.
The maximum rate
s
for
Storage, Parking and Lending
S
ervice pursuant to Section 311(a)(2)
of the NGPA shall be the maximum rate approved by the FERC for storage by Company under
Section 311(a)(2) of the NGPA
as
shown in Section 20
.
Notwithstanding the foregoing sentence, the
rate to be charged for storage may be agreed to between Company and Shipper, provided that such agreed
-
to
rate may not exceed the maximum unit rate approved by the FERC for such storage, and
provided further that such agreed
-
to
rate may not be less than any minimum rate, if any, as defined
by the FERC.
B
.
Company222s
maximum rate
s
for
Storage, Parking and Lending
S
ervice pursuant to Section
311(a)(2) of the NGPA shall be determined pursuant to Section 284.123(b)(
2) of the FERC
regulations. Company reserves the right to file for a higher maximum rate at any time and the maximum rate which Shipper agrees to pay shall be revised to equal such higher maximum.
SECTION 3
FUEL Fuel
may be paid in kind at Shipper222s Receipt Point(s) or in dollars per MMBtu, as set forth in
Shipper222s S
torage A
greement.
SECTION 4
CAPACITY AVAILABLE FOR FIRM STORAGE AGREEMENTS
3
A.
Firm capacity that is or becomes available in Storage Facility
from time to time shall be
allocated on a net present value basis. To the extent that two (2) or more requests for firm
Storage,
Parking or Lending
S
ervice are received during the same Evaluation Period and such requests
involve the same capacity, in whole or in part, then firm capacity will be allocated to that request(s) generating the highest net present value to Company. Net present value will be
determined based on
the discounted cash flow of revenues to Company produced, lost, or affected by the request(s) for service. In determining the highest net present value, Company will consider objective criteria only.
Such criteria may include, without limitation, the M
aximum
S
torage
Q
uantity requested, the offered
rate, the date on which the requested service would commence, and such other objective criteria available based on the requests for service received by Company. The net present value discou
nt
factor used by Company will be applied consistently to all requests for capacity within an Evaluation Period.
B.
In the event that Company receives two (2) or more requests for firm storage service which
produce an equivalent net present value, any ava
ilable capacity will be allocated between or among
such requests on a pro rata basis; provided, however, if one or more party(s) is offered capacity on a pro rata basis pursuant to this Section and any party declines to contract for such capacity, such par
ty222s request shall be deemed null and void and the available capacity will be reallocated among
such remaining requests which produced the equivalent net present values.
C.
To the extent Company has available unsubscribed firm capacity, Company reserves
the
right, but shall not be obligated, to reserve such capacity for system balancing purposes should additional capacity be needed.
SECTION 5
REQUESTS FOR STORAGE, PARKING
AND LENDING
SERVICE A.
Company will accept as valid only those requests which, in
Company222s sole judgement, are
sufficiently specific with respect to the following information, all of which must be provided as set forth below:
1.
Type of service requested (firm or interruptible) and
as applicable:
Maximum
Storage Quantity (stated in
MMBtu), Maximum Daily Withdrawal Quantity (stated in
MMBtu/day), Maximum Daily Injection Quantity (stated in MMBtu/day).
2.
Receipt Points:
(a)
Point(s) of entry into Company222s Storage Facility
.
(b)
Name of entity delivering gas into Company222s Storage Facility
.
3.
Delivery Points: (a)
Point(s) of exit from Company222s Storage Facility
.
(b)
Name of entities to which Company delivers gas from Storage Facility
.
4
4.
Term of proposed service:
(a)
Date service is requested to commence.
(b)
Date service is requested to terminate.
5.
Certification that the Shipper has a current contractual right to take possession of the
gas to be delivered to Company for S
torage
,
Parking
or Lending Service
and will enter into
those arrangements necessary to assure all upstream and downstream transportation will be in place prior to the execution of a Storage Agreement
by Company.
6.
The name, address, title, and telephone number of the corporate officer of Shipper
who will execute the Storage Agreement
.
7.
For NGPA Section 311
storage service, a statement indicating the 223on behalf of224
entity(ies) that Shipper warrants meets the provisions of Section 284 of the Commission222s Regulations.
B.
Unless waived by Company, requests for Storage, Parking or Lending
S
ervice hereunder will
be invalid and will not be considered if a Storage Agreement
is not entered into within forty
-
five
(45) days of the date of receipt of the information specified in this section; provided, however, that in no event will Company be required to perform servic
e hereunder prior to such time that Shipper
satisfies such condition. Requests which cannot be provided due to insufficient capacity, or because of a failure to satisfy the terms of this Statement of Operating Conditions within forty
-
five (45) days
of the
date the request is made, shall not be of a continuing nature and shall be deemed a nullity for
all present and future purposes.
SECTION 6
TERM
Service will be provided for a negotiated term; provided, however, Company shall have the right to terminate
or suspend service immediately upon notice of such termination or suspension given to a
Shipper in the event (i) Company, on a non-
discriminatory basis, shall also concurrently terminate or
suspend, as the case may be, all of its Storage, Parking or Lendi
ng
S
ervices of the same type as that
service which was terminated or suspended, or (ii) deliveries of gas under the
Storage A
greement
once commenced, have ceased for any period of ninety (90) consecutive days or more and not resumed.
SECTION 7
CREDITWORTHINESS
A.
Company
shall not be required to perform or continue to perform service on behalf of any
Shipper that (i) has applied for bankruptcy under any chapter of the Bankruptcy Code, (ii) has failed
5
to make prompt and full payment to Company
when due f
or
storage
services rendered by Company,
or (iii) fails, in Company222s sole judgment, to demonstrate creditworthiness.
B
.
If Shipper222s creditworthiness becomes unsatisfactory,
in Company222s sole discretion,
Company
may require assurance of Shipper222s ability
to pay or require different terms of payment.
Such assurance may, at the option of
Company, include (i) the required posting of a letter of credit in
form and from a financial institution acceptable to Company; (ii) cash prepayments; or (iii) other deliv
ery of other security acceptable to the Company.
Upon receipt of such notice, Shipper shall
have two business days to provide the assurance demanded by the Company
and the
Company
shall
have the right to withhold payment, suspend deliveries from the time that the Company
requests
such assurances until such assurances are provided. In the event such assurance is not provided within two business days of receipt of notice, then a breach of the applicable Storage Agreement
will
be deemed to have occurred and t
he
Company
shall be entitled to (i) terminate one or more
Storage
Agreement
s with Shipper, (ii) liquidate gas balances in Company222s position for the purpose paying
all amounts that become owing for services under any Storage Agreement
s governed by this
Sta
tement of Operating
Conditions, and (iii) seek all other remedies available for breach of the
applicable Storage Agreement
.
SECTION 8
NEW FACILITIES
A.
Company shall not be required to provide any requested Storage, Parking or Lending
S
ervice
which woul
d require construction or acquisition by Company of any new facilities or expansion of
Company222s existing facilities. Company, in its sole discretion, may agree to construct or acquire new facilities, or expand existing facilities, to provide service reque
sted by any Shipper. In such event,
Shipper agrees to reimburse Company for the total incremental cost of the new facilities or expansion of existing facilities, unless otherwise mutually agreed in writing. Company shall determine method of reimbursement, either lump sum or installment.
B.
To the extent Company agrees to construct or acquire any new facilities or expand existing
facilities, any such facilities shall be contracted, maintained, owned, and operated by Company, except as may otherwise be mu
tually agreed in writing. The design and installation of all facilities
shall be in accordance with the specifications determined by Company in its sole, reasonable discretion.
SECTION 9
NOMINATIONS
A.
If Shipper desires service under its Storage Agre
ement
on any day, Shipper shall give written
notice of Shipper222s nomination to Company specifying the quantity of gas Shipper requests under each of Shipper222s Storage Agreement
s for each day of the service month. Such nomination should
6
reflect the injection quantity for each Receipt Point or the withdrawal quantity for each Delivery Point. Shipper shall furnish such nomination to Company by facsimile or other electronic means and
such nomination shall also specify such information as Company determines is
necessary in order to
perform the service requested by Shipper. Injections and withdrawals of gas herewith shall be at uniform hourly rates of flow unless otherwise mutually agreed by Shipper and Company.
B.
For Shipper222s nominations to be accepted for
the first (1st) day of the service month,
Shipper222s nominations must be received by Company by 1:00 p.m.
Central Clock Time on the
business day prior to the last day of the month preceding the service month.
C.
Shippers shall have the right, on or after the first (1st) day of the service month, to submit a
new nomination or revise their existing nomination for any day during the service month provided
such nomination is received by Company prior to 1:00 p.m.
Central Clock Time on the business day
prior to the day such new or revised service is requested to commence. Such new or revised
nomination shall specify Shipper222s anticipated service requirements for the remainder of the service month. New or revised nominations shall be schedule
d and implemented by Company on a
prospective basis and only to the extent the Company is able to confirm the receipt and delivery of such gas with the operator of the Receipt Points or Delivery Points. If a conflict arises between Shipper222s new or revise
d nomination and the operator222s confirmation, Shipper understands and
agrees such Receipt or Delivery Point operator222s confirmation shall control.
D.
Company may, in its sole, reasonable discretion, accept Shipper222s new or revised nomination
if such nomination is received by Company after 1:00 p.m.
Central Clock Time on the business day
prior to the day such new or revised service is requested to commence. Such new or revised nomination shall specify Shipper222s anticipated service requirements fo
r the remainder of the service
month. New or revised nominations shall be scheduled and implemented by Company on a prospective basis and only to the extent the Company is able to confirm the receipt or delivery of such gas with the operator of the Receip
t Points or Delivery Points. Such scheduling and
implementation shall not 223bump224 any previously scheduled service. If a conflict arises between Shipper222s new or revised nomination and the operator222s confirmation, Shipper understands and agrees such Recei
pt or Delivery Point operator222s confirmation shall control.
E.
All nominations will designate a person who will be responsible for coordinating notices
between Company and operators of the Shipper222s Receipt and Delivery Points in accordance with these pro
cedures.
SECTION 10
SCHEDULING
Capacity in Company222s pipeline system shall be scheduled each day in the following order and manner:
7
A.
Firm service shall receive first priority. Within this category, Company shall schedule
nominated service on a pro r
ata basis.
B.
Interruptible Service shall receive second priority. Within this category, Company shall
schedule nominated service on an economic basis. As such, Company shall accord service paying a higher rate per MMBtu a higher priority than service
paying a lower rate. If two or more Shippers
are paying the same rate per MMBtu, Company shall schedule nominated service on a pro-
rata basis
SECTION 1
1 CURTAILMENT A.
Company shall have the right to curtail or discontinue storage services in whole or
in part at
any time for reasons of force majeure or when in Company222s sole judgement, capacity or operating conditions so require or it is desirable or necessary to make modifications, repairs or operating changes to its system.
B.
Company shall provide Shipper such notice of the curtailment as is reasonable under the
circumstances. In the event curtailment of storage service is required, service quantities shall be curtailed in the reverse order of the priority in effect at the time of curtailment estab
lished during
scheduling as set forth in Section 10.
SECTION 1
2 FORCE MAJEURE
A.
In the event Company or Shipper is rendered unable, wholly or in part, by reason of force
majeure to carry out its obligations under the Storage Agreement
(other than the obligation to make
payment of amounts due hereunder), it is agreed that such party shall give notice and reasonably full
particulars of such force majeure, in writing, facsimile, or other electronic means to the other party within a reasonable time after th
e occurrence of the cause relied on, and the obligations of the party
giving such notice, so far as they are affected by such force majeure, shall be suspended during the continuance of any inability so caused, but for no longer period, and such cause shal
l, so far as
possible, be remedied with all reasonable dispatch. If sent by facsimile transmission, confirmation shall occur when receipt is confirmed by the equipment of the transmitting party.
B.
The term, 223force majeure,224 as employed herein shall mean acts of God; strikes, lockouts, or
other industrial disturbances; conditions arising from a change in governmental laws, orders, rules, or regulations; acts of public enemy; wars; blockades; insurrections; riots; epidemics; landslides; lightning; earthquakes; fires; storms; floods; washouts; arrests and restraints of governments and people; civil disturbances; explosions; breakage or accident to machinery or lines of pipe; the necessity for making repairs, tests, alterations, or performing maintenance to machinery or lines of pipe; scheduled maintenance; freezing of lines of pipe; or failure of processing facilities; and any other causes, whether of the kind herein enumerated or otherwise, not within the control of the party
8
claiming relief hereunder, and which by the exercise of due diligence, such party is unable to prevent or overcome. Such term shall likewise include: (1) those instances where either Company or Shipper is required to obtain servitudes, rights
-
of
-
way, grants, permits or licenses to enabl
e such
party to fulfill its obligations under the Storage Agreement
; the inability of such party to acquire or
the delays on the part of such party in acquiring, at reasonable costs, and after the exercise of reasonable diligence, such servitudes, rights
-
o
f
-
way, grants, permits, or licenses, (2) those instances
where either Company or Shipper is required to furnish materials and supplies for the purpose of constructing or maintaining facilities or is required to secure permits or permissions from any governmental agency to enable such party to fulfill its obligations under the
Storage Agreement
, the
inability of such party to acquire, or the delays on the part of such party in acquiring, at reasonable costs, and after the exercise of reasonable diligence, su
ch material and supplies, permits and
permissions, and (3) in those instances in which Company utilizes facilities of another entity or entities to transport gas under the Storage Agreement
, the failure of such other entity or entities to
transport such ga
s. Force majeure shall not include failure of gas supply due to pricing
considerations.
C.
It is understood and agreed that the settlement of strikes or lockouts shall be entirely within
the discretion of the party having the difficulty, and that the above requirement that any force majeure shall be remedied with all reasonable dispatch shall not require the settlement of strikes or lockouts by acceding to the demands of the opposing party when such course is inadvisable in the discretion of the party having the difficulty.
D.
Notwithstanding the foregoing, it is specifically understood and agreed by Company and
Shipper that force majeure shall in no way terminate the parties222 obligations to resolve Imbalances in
accordance with the terms provided for her
ein.
SECTION 1
3 QUALITY A.
All gas received or delivered hereunder shall conform to the following specifications:
1.
Water
: The gas shall not have a water content in excess of 7 pounds of water per
million (1,000,000) cubic feet of gas measured at a p
ressure base of 14.73 pounds per square
inch absolute and at a temperature of sixty degrees Fahrenheit (60
F).
2.
Hydrogen Sulfide
: The gas shall not contain more than 274 grain of hydrogen sulfide
per one hundred (100) cubic feet as determined by quantit
ative test.
3.
Total Sulfur
: The gas shall not contain more than four (4) grains of total sulfur per
one hundred (100) cubic feet of gas as determined by quantitative test.
4.
Temperature: The gas shall not have a temperature of less than forty degrees
Fahrenheit (40 F), nor more than one hundred twenty degrees Fahrenheit (120 F).
9
5.
Carbon Dioxide
: The gas shall not contain carbon dioxide in excess of two
percent
(
2%) by volume.
6.
Oxygen
: The gas shall not contain more than one tenth of one percent (0.1%) by
volume of oxygen.
7.
Nitrogen
: The gas shall not contain nitrogen in excess of three
percent (
3%) by
volume.
8.
Non
-
hydrocarbons
: The gas shall not contain more than four and one half percent
(4275%) by volume of total non-
hydrocarbons. Non-
hydrocarbons s
hall include, but not be
limited to, carbon dioxide, nitrogen, sulfur and hydrogen sulfide.
9.
Objectionable Liquids and Solids, and Dilution: The gas shall be free of
objectionable liquids and solids, and be commercially free from dust, gums, gum
-
forming
constituents, or other liquid or solid matter which might become separated from the gas in the course of transportation through pipelines.
10.
Heating Value
: The gas shall not have a heating value of less than 950 Btus per
cubic foot.
11.
Carbonyl Sulfi
de:
This gas shall not
contain carbonyl sulfide greater than 5 ppm
of the propane as determined by quantitative test.
B.
Notwithstanding
A 1 through A11
above, inclusive, all gas delivered or caused to be
delivered by Shipper to Company
at the Receipt Po
int(s) shall conform to the most strict quality
specification of the downstream pipelines at the Delivery Points for each individual quality specification, any of which may be waived by
Company
in its discretion on a nondiscriminatory
basis.
C.
Company shall not be obligated to accept gas hereunder, which does not conform to these
specifications. In the event gas received hereunder does not conform to these quality specifications, Company shall notify Shipper of such nonconformance and Shipper shall immediately cease delivery of gas to Company or bring such gas within specification. Company, at its sole option, may elect from time to time to receive such gas not conforming to the quality specifications herein. Company reserves the right to modify these qu
ality specifications as the quality specifications of the
downstream pipelines are modified. Acceptance by either party of gas that does not conform to the quality specifications stated above shall not constitute a waiver of such quality specifications by
that
party in regard to gas received or delivered under the Storage Agreement
in the future, nor shall
acceptance without an express written waiver constitute a waiver of any claim for damages resulting from delivery of gas not meeting such specifications
.
10
SECTION 1
4 BILLING AND PAYMENT
A.
For the purpose of billing and accounting for the gas delivered hereunder, the day shall begin
at 9:00 a.m. Central Clock Time and extend to 9:00 a.m. the following day, and the month (hereinafter called 223billing month224) shall begin at 9:00 a.m. Central Clock Time on the first day of the calendar month and extend to 9:00 a.m. on the first day of the following calendar month.
B.
Company shall render or cause to be rendered, by mail, facsimile or other electronic means,
to all Shippers an invoice of the amount due for the preceding month setting forth the total quantity of gas delivered by Company to Shipper at the Delivery Points and the rates for
storage
hereunder
during such billing month. Billings for quantities tra
nsported shall be determined on a dry basis. In
computing the amounts due, Company may utilize estimates of the quantity of gas received from or delivered for the account of Shipper during a month, in place of actual quantities when actual quantities are not reasonably available; provided that adjustments shall be made in later statements
for differences between such estimated and actual quantities. When information necessary for
billing purposes is in the control of Shipper, Shipper222s gas seller, or Shipper222s downstream pipeline
or purchaser, Shipper shall furnish such information to Company on or before the fifth (5th) day of
the calendar month following the month of storage
.
C.
Within ten (10) days from date of the invoice, Shipper shall pay Company the amount due
for all gas delivered by Company for the account of Shipper during the preceding month. Payments
to Company shall be made by wire transfer crediting Company, such that funds are available to
Company on or before the tenth (10th) day after the
date of the invoice. If rendering of an invoice
by Company is delayed after the fifteenth (15th) day of the month, then the time of payment shall be
extended accordingly unless Shipper is responsible for such delay.
D.
Good Faith Dispute
. If a portion of an invoice is disputed, Shipper shall pay when due the portion of the invoice not in dispute and shall at the same time provide Company with documentation supporting its dispute. E.
Late Payment
. In the event Shipper fails to forward the entire undis
puted amount due to Company
when same is due, interest on the unpaid portion shall accrue at a rate equal to two percent
(2%) above the prime rate published in the
Wall Street Journal,
from time to time, or the maximum
legal rate, whichever is the lesser, compounded daily from the date such payment is due until the same is Shipper shall not be required to pay interest on any amount billed which is in good faith disputed in writing by Shipper and is ultimately determined to be in error; provided, however, in
terest shall be due if such amount billed is found not to be in error. F.
Examination of Books, Records and Charts
. Company and Shipper shall have the right during reasonable working hours and after execution of a confidentiality agreement to examine the
books, records and charts of the other to the extent necessary to verify the accuracy of any statement, payment calculations or determinations made pursuant to the provision contained herein. The accuracy of any statement, payment calculations or determi
nations made pursuant to the provisions
11
B.
The temperature of the gas shall be determined by a recording thermometer so installed that
it will record the temperature of the gas flowing through the
meters. The average of the record to the
nearest one degree (1260) Fahrenheit, obtained while gas is being delivered, shall be the applicable flowing gas temperature for the period under consideration. For all measurement of gas required in this Section, the Btu content per cubic foot shall be determined for a cubic foot of gas at a temperature of sixty degrees (60260) Fahrenheit, at an absolute pressure of 14.73 pounds per square inch on a dry basis.
C.
The Btu, specific gravity, carbon dioxide, nitroge
n and hydrocarbon content of the gas
delivered to the Receipt or Delivery Points shall be determined by the use of an on-
line
chromatograph or by a chromatographic analysis of the gas obtained by a continuous sample or spot sampling method. The results of
any sample taken with an on-
line chromatograph or continuous
sampler shall be applied to the month in which the sample was taken. The results of any spot sample taken shall be applied to the month succeeding the month in which the sample was taken.
1.
Delivery Points with consistent quantities of 25 MMcf per day or greater will have an
on-
line gas chromatograph, subject to adequate site facilities being available, including the
availability of electricity and land to accommodate the necessary equipment
, otherwise a
continuous Btu sampler will be used to determine gas quality. Upon mutual agreement by the parties, an alternate method of measurement may be used.
2.
Receipt Points with quantities equal to or less than 25 MMcf per day will use, at
Comp
any222s
sole option, either a spot sampling technique or a continuous sampling
technique.
D.
Adjustment for the effect of supercompressibility shall be made according to the provisions
of the latest version of AGA Committee Report No. 8, as required by Para
graph A of this section and
as adopted by
Company, for the average conditions of pressure, flowing temperature, and specific
gravity at which the gas was measured during the period under consideration and with the proportionate values each of carbon dioxide, nitrogen and other applicable constituent in the gas delivered included in the computation of the applicable supercompressibility factors.
E.
If at any time during the term hereof a new method or technique is developed with respect to
gas measurement o
r the determination of the factors used in such gas measurement, such new
method or technique may be substituted for the gas measurement set forth in this Section on the date such method or technique is adopted by Company.
SECTION 1
7 MEASURING EQUIPMENT AND TESTING
A.
Installation and Operation
. The construction, ownership, operation and maintenance of any measuring facilities necessary to accomplish the receipt of gas by Company
for the account of
Shipper at the Receipt Points and the delivery of gas f
or the account of Shipper at the Delivery
13
Points shall be the responsibility of
Company
or designee. Each party shall at all reasonable times
have access to the premises of the other for inspections, insofar as such premises are connected with any matter covered hereby. The operation of measuring equipment, changing of charts and/or collection of information shall be done only by the employees or agents of
Company
at the Receipt
Points and the Delivery Points. B.
Testing and Repair of Equipment.
1.
Com
pany
and Shipper shall keep their own measuring equipment accurate and in
repair, making such periodic tests to verify the condition of meter tubes, orifice plate, and flow computer. Such periodic tests shall be performed, at a minimum, on a quarterly bas
is
for Receipt Points and a monthly basis for Delivery Points, unless mutually agreed otherwise. Both parties agree to give each other or their designee seven (7) calendar days notice prior to such tests of the measuring equipment so that, if desired, eit
her party may
have its representative present. Either party shall have the right to challenge the accuracy of the other party222s equipment, and when challenged, the equipment shall be tested, calibrated and, if required, repaired by the challenged party, t
he cost of such special test to be borne by
the challenged party if the inaccuracy is found to cause the total measured Btu during a month to be more than one percent (1%) of such total measured Btu, but if the inaccuracy is found to cause the total measur
ed Btu during a month to be one percent (1%) or less of such
total measured Btu, the cost of such special test shall be borne by the challenging party. If upon any equipment test the inaccuracy and all prior inaccuracies resulting from other equipment tes
ts during the same period are found to cause the total measured Btu during a
month to be in excess of one percent (1%) of such total measured Btu and the total measurement adjustment during a month is greater than 100 MMBtu, then the registrations thereof
shall be corrected for a period extending back to the time such inaccuracy occurred,
if such time is ascertainable, and if such time is not ascertainable, then back one
-
half (1/2) of
the time elapsed since the last date of equipment calibration. If upon a
ny equipment test the
inaccuracy and all prior inaccuracies resulting from other equipment tests covering the same period are found to cause the total measured Btu during a month to be less than one percent (1%) of such total measured Btu or the total meas
urement adjustment during a month is less
than 100 MMBtu, then, the operator of the measuring equipment, at its sole option, may
cause the registrations thereof to be corrected for a period extending back to the time such inaccuracy occurred, if such time is ascertainable, and if such time not ascertainable, then back one
-
half (1/2) of the time elapsed since the last date of calibration. Any measuring
equipment found to be measuring inaccurately in any percentage shall be adjusted at once to read accuratel
y.
2.
If, for any reason, the meter(s) are out of service or out of repair so that the amount of
gas received and/or delivered cannot be ascertained or computed from the readings thereof, the gas received and/or delivered during the period such meter(s) a
re out of service or out of
repair shall be estimated and agreed upon by the parties hereto by the use of the first applicable of the following methods:
14
a.
By comparative utilization of any like check measuring equipment installed
by Shipper or Shipper222s designee if such check measuring equipment can be proven
and verified to be measuring accurately subject to the check meter provisions in Paragraph E of this section; or
b.
By computing the error if the percentage of error is ascertainable by
calibration,
test or mathematical calculation; or
c.
By estimating the quantity received and/or delivered by reference to actual
receipts and/or deliveries during preceding periods under similar conditions when Company222s
measuring equipment was registering accurately
.
C.
Pulsation Induced Measurement Errors and Reduction
1.
To ensure orifice metering accuracy, pulsation induced orifice measurement errors
shall not exceed .25% Square Root Error (SRE) during any diagnostic testing. Orifice measurement facilities and r
elated piping elements included in this contract found to exhibit
excessive SRE levels shall be modified to suppress pulsation effects below .25% SRE. The installation of impulse line snubbers or excessive dampening of bellows type meters are unacceptable
practices in the effort to reduce pulsation effects. Acceptable practices include
the installation of in
-
line acoustic filter bottles/chokes or in
-
line restrictive orifices. The use
of in
-
line restrictive orifices should be used for short-
term pulsation
reduction until acoustic
filter bottles can be installed, particularly in high SRE pulsation environments.
2.
The party responsible for inducing pulsation related measurement errors shall bear
the cost for the design, fabrication, installation and ope
ration of the necessary remedial
equipment or devices, including consulting fees for diagnostic work.
3.
If operating conditions (i.e., flow rates, compressor operating speeds, pressures)
change significantly after the installation of the pulsation supp
ression equipment/devices, the
responsible party shall initiate follow
-
up pulsation testing to ensure that the remedial
equipment or devices are maintaining SRE levels below .25% SRE. If SRE levels are excessive after the re-
testing, the responsible party
shall modify or redesign the remedial
equipment or devices to maintain SRE below .25%.
4.
Remedial actions necessary to bring SRE levels to acceptable levels must be
completed within 30 days from the date of diagnostic testing. Failure to comply with t
his
requirement will result in potential well or station shut-
in. At the gatherer222s discretion,
retroactive volume adjustments can be made based on the results of diagnostic testing.
D
.
Inspection of Data and Records
. The data and records from the
measuring equipment shall remain the property of Company
and shall be kept on file for a period of time not less than two (2)
years from the end of the calendar year in which the charts and records were generated or prepared. At any time within such perio
d, upon written request by Shipper, records and/or data from the
15
measuring equipment, together with calculations therefrom, will be submitted for Shipper222s inspection and verification subject to return to Company
within thirty (30) days from receipt thereo
f.
Shipper or Shipper222s designee shall retain its charts and records for the same period of time as Company222s
obligation under this paragraph. Any inquiries regarding measurement equipment and
testing, including but not limited to, measurement charts, re
cords, or audits of charts and records
shall be directed to Manager, Measurement.
E
.
Telemetering
. Company
and Shipper shall each have the right, but not the obligation, to install and operate telemetering equipment it deems necessary to carry out Superv
isory Control and
Data Acquisition (SCADA) or other operational needs at any Receipt and/or Delivery Points contemplated hereunder, provided Company222s
normal operations are not impeded. Custody
measurement taps will not be shared under any circumstance.
F
.
Check Meter
. Shipper or Shipper222s designee shall have the right to install, maintain as described in Paragraph A of this Section, and operate such check measurement equipment as it may desire, but same shall not interfere with or impede in any way the operation of Company222s
measurement or other equipment hereunder, and all calibrating and adjusting of check meters and changing of charts shall be done by Shipper or its designees. Such check meters may be installed at the Receipt Points only, unless the D
elivery Points are at Shipper222s or its designee222s pipeline.
Further,
Company
must be notified seven (7) calendar days prior to all testing and calibration in
order to have a representative present. In the event Company
proves the inaccuracy of Shipper222s
check meter or all applicable check meter maintenance records are not available, both parties agree to incorporate the next applicable alternate method detailed in Paragraph B.2 of this Section to resolve the discrepancy
SECTION 1
8 RECEIPT AND DELIVERY PRESSURES
A.
All gas delivered hereunder by Shipper shall be delivered at pressures sufficient to enter
Company222s
Storage Facility
at the working pressures maintained at the Receipt Points from time to
time. Company shall not be obligated to receive ga
s hereunder at pressures exceeding the maximum
allowable operating pressures of the facilities or pressures prescribed under any applicable
governmental regulations. Company shall at no time be required, unless otherwise agreed in writing, to construct or
modify facilities currently existing, including compression, to effect such receipt,
including but not limited to, instances when the upstream facility changes its operating conditions from those in effect at the time the interconnection was completed.
B.
All gas delivered hereunder by Company shall be delivered at pressures sufficient to enter
the downstream facilities at the working pressures maintained at the Delivery Points from time to time. Company shall not be obligated to deliver gas hereunder a
t pressures exceeding the maximum
16
allowable operating pressures of the facilities or pressures prescribed under any applicable governmental regulations. Notwithstanding the foregoing, Company shall at no time be required, unless otherwise agreed in writin
g, to construct or modify facilities currently existing, including
compression, to effect such delivery including, but not limited to, instances when the downstream facility changes its operating conditions from those in effect at the time the interconnect
ion was
completed.
C.
All gas redelivered at the redelivery point(s) shall be redelivered at pressures sufficient to
enter the receiving party222s facilities at such point; provided, however, Company shall not be required to compress gas or be obligated to construct or modify facilities currently existing.
SECTION 19 MISCELLANEOUS
A.
BASIC FUNCTION. Company
is first and foremost a
Storage Facility
. Therefore, any Section 311(a)(2) service that Company
provides will be consistent with and shall not infri
nge upon
its status as a non
-
jurisdictional intrastate pipeline and shall not subject Company
to the FERC222s
Natural Gas Act jurisdiction.
B
.
REGULATORY STATUS OF
GAS
1.
Whenever Shipper222s gas is delivered to a Receipt Point or received from a Delivery
Po
int that is not
an interconnect with the facilities of an interstate pipeline company, Shipper shall
(unless Shipper shall expressly advise Company
otherwise in writing at the time of
submitting its nomination to Company
)
be deemed to have represented and warranted to
Company
that all of the g
as so delivered to Company
or received from Company
shall (i)
have been produced in the State of Texas from reserves not dedicated or committed to interstate commerce, (ii) not be or have not been received from or tran
sported through any
interstate pipeline company or any intrastate pipeline company which claims exemption from the provisions of the Natural Gas Act of 1938 pursuant to Section 1(c) thereof, and (iii) not have been or be commingled at any point with
gas wh
ich is received from or transported
through any interstate pipeline company or any intrastate pipeline company which claims exemption from the provisions of the Natural Gas Act of 1938 pursuant to Section 1(c) thereof, or with gas which is or may be sold, consumed, transported, or otherwise utilized in interstate commerce, in such a manner which will subject the gas delivered by or to Shipper hereunder or any of Company222s or its affiliate222s pipeline, transmission, storage or related facilities, or any portions thereof, to the jurisdiction of the FERC or any successor authority incident to the provisions of Section 1(b) or Section 1(c) of the Natural Gas Act of 1938 (the 223NGA224).
2.
Whenever (i) Shipper222s gas is delivered to a Receipt Point or received from a
Delivery Point that is an interconnection between the
Storage Facility
and the facilities of an
interstate pipeline company or (ii) Shipper expressly advises Company
in the manner
17
contemplated in the first sentence of Section 19.B.
1 above),
Shipper shall
be deemed to
have represented and warranted to Company
that
storage
of
gas hereunder is 223on behalf of224
an interstate pipeline company or a local distribution company served by an interstate
pipeline company and otherwise qualifies as storage
pursuant to Se
ction 311(a)(2) of the
NGPA and FERC222s rules, regulations and orders thereunder. If requested by Company, Shipper shall provide evidence satisfactory to Company
that the service provided hereunder
is 223on behalf of224 an interstate pipeline company or a loca
l distribution company served by an
interstate pipeline company, and that such service otherwise qualifies as storage
pursuant to
Section 311(a)(2) of the NGPA and the Commission222s rules, regulations and orders thereunder.
3.
Company shall have no obligat
ion under this Statement of Operating Conditions
if
Company, in its sole discretion determines at any time that Shipper has breached any applicable representation or warranty referenced above or that the
storage
to be provided
hereunder does not so qualify. Shipper agrees to indemnify and hold
Company
harmless
from and against and shall compensate Shipper for any and all actions, damages, costs, losses and expenses sustained by Company
relative to any breach by Shipper of any
representation or warranty herein expressed.
C.
CHANGES TO THIS STATEMENT.
Company
reserves the right to add, delete or modify conditions in this Statement of Operating Conditions at any time in accordance with the FERC222s Regulations under 18 CFR Section 284.123(e). A copy of the re
vised Statement of Operating
Conditions will be furnished to Shippers who request it. D
.
CONFLICTS AND AUTHORITY OF STATEMENT.
The rules and regulations of the jurisdictional agency govern all services provided under Section 311(a)(2), and in the event a
ny
contract term or provision is inconsistent with these rules and regulations or this Statement of Operating Conditions, the rules and regulations or this Statement of Operating Conditions will control and the contract will be deemed modified accordingly. E
.
POSSESSION AND NON-
ODORIZATION OF GAS.
As between Shipper and Company, Shipper shall be in exclusive control and possession of the gas deliverable and responsible for any damage or injury caused thereby until the same shall have been received by Comp
any
for the
account of Shipper at the Receipt Points and after delivery of the gas by
Company
for the account of
Shipper at the Delivery Points. After delivery of gas by Shipper to
Company, and until delivery by
Company
to Shipper or Shipper222s designee, C
ompany
shall be in exclusive control and possession
thereof and responsible for any injury or damage caused thereby. The Receipt and Delivery Points hereunder shall be deemed to be located at the flanges connecting the facilities owned by
Company
with tho
se facilities owned, leased or used by Shipper or Shipper222s designee or its gas supplier for
the receipt and delivery of gas hereunder. Each party expressly notifies the other that the gas delivered to the Receipt and Delivery Points hereunder is not odor
ized. In the event that either
party, at its own election or pursuant to laws, orders, rules or regulations of any governmental body having jurisdiction, elects or is required to odorize the gas deliverable hereunder, then such party shall give prior written notice to the other of its intention to odorize such gas.
18
F
.
TITLE AND RISK OF LOSS.
Shipper warrants for itself, its successors and assigns, that it will have at the time of delivery of gas at the Receipt Point hereunder either good title or all rig
hts
necessary and appropriate to have the gas
stored
. Shipper warrants for itself, its successors and
assigns, that the gas it delivers hereunder shall be free and clear of all liens, encumbrances and claims on the title to the gas; and that it will indem
nify and hold harmless Company, its officers,
agents, employees and contractors from and against any and all suits, claims, liability, loss, damages, costs (including attorney222s fees and court costs) or encumbrances whatsoever arising directly or indirectly from and with respect to the title and/or right to gas tendered to Company
hereunder.
Company
warrants that at the time of delivery to Shipper at the Delivery Point the gas delivered
hereunder shall be free and clear of all liens, encumbrances and claim
s on the title to the gas; and
that it will indemnify and hold harmless Shipper, its officers, agents, employees and contractors against any and all suits, claims, liability, loss, damages, costs (including attorney222s fees and court costs) or encumbrances whatsoever arising directly or indirectly from or with respect to the title and/or right to gas delivered to Shipper as a result of Company222s possession or
storage
hereunder.
Title and/or rights to all gas delivered by Shipper to Company
for
storage
, here
under will remain
with Shipper during storage
by
Company; provided, however, it is understood and agreed that the
gas delivered at the Delivery Point
will not be the identical gas that was delivered to Company
for
storage
, hereunder, but such gas will be a
part of the commingled delivery of gas and, for the
purpose of Shipper222s Storage A
greement, the commingled gas may be substituted for Shipper222s gas
on a heat
-
equivalent basis.
G
.
GOVERNING LAWS AND REGULATIONS.
The interpretation and performance of any S
torage Agreement
that is subject to this Statement of Operating Conditions shall be governed by,
construed, interpreted and enforced in accordance with the substantive laws of the State of
Texas,
without reference to its choice of law doctrine. Company222s
storage
services are subject to all present
and future valid lawful orders of all regulatory authorities now or hereafter having jurisdiction of the services or facilities used to provide such services, including, without limitation, the provisions of Subpart C of Part 284 of the Commission222s Regulations. In the event any regulatory body having jurisdiction over the storage
service prohibits Company
from collecting specific rates for the
services provided under the Storage Agreement
or subjects its storage
facilities to any greater or
different regulation or jurisdiction than that existing on the date of initial storage
service hereunder
(or thereafter as such regulation or jurisdiction may have changed and been accepted), then Company
shall have the right to terminate the Storage Agreement
on the effective date of such
regulation, anything herein to the contrary notwithstanding and shall have no liability to Shipper or any other entity in connection with any such termination. H
.
ARBITRATION.
1.
In the event the Company
and Shipper are unable to resolve any dispute regarding the
application or interpretation of any provision of a Storage Agreement
or related transaction
such dispute shall be resolved through mandatory arbitration under the Rules of the Center For Public Resources Institute For Dispute Resolution, to the extent not inconsistent with the rules specified herein.
19
2.
Within twenty (20) B
usiness
D
ays of either Company222s or Shipper222s written election
to the other to arbitrate any disputes which a
rise under this Statement of Operating
Condtions
, each party shall choose one arbitrator, and within ten (10) Business Days after
both such arbitrators are chosen, such arbitrators shall choose a third arbitrator thus completing the whole arbitration panel
. Any arbitrator chosen shall be a disinterested party
with knowledge of the industry. Any arbitration hereunder shall be conducted in
Houston
Texas. 3.
The arbitrator(s), once chosen, shall consider any evidence which the arbitrators
deem necessary and shall then accept sealed written resolutions of the subject dispute from each party on a confidential basis to be submitted within twenty (20) Business Days of establishment of the arbitration panel. The written submissions shall be in a form and subject
to any limitations as may be prescribed by the arbitrators. The arbitrators shall then
choose
only one
of the proposed solutions, (without modification) as the fairest solution to the dispute within ten (10) Business Days of receipt of the written submiss
ions of both
parties. In the event of a three
-
member arbitration panel, a majority vote shall govern. The
decision of the arbitrators shall be final and non-
appealable.
4.
Any expenses incurred in connection with hiring the arbitrators and
performing t
he arbitration shall be shared and paid equally between the parties. Each party
shall bear and pay its own expenses incurred in connection with the arbitration, unless otherwise included in a solution chosen by the arbitration panel. In the event either
party
must file a court action to enforce an arbitration award under this Section, the prevailing party shall be entitled to recover its court costs and reasonable attorney fees. In respect of any suit, action, claim or proceeding relating to this Statement of Operating Conditions
, each
party hereby waives, to the fullest extent permitted by law, any right to jury trial. The existence, contents or results of any arbitration hereunder may not be disclosed without the prior written consent of both parties. The parties submit to the non-
exclusive jurisdiction of
the courts of the State of Texas.
I
.
LIMITATIONS OF REMEDIES, LIABILITY AND DAMAGES. NO PARTY SHALL
BE LIABLE FOR CONSEQUENTIAL, INCIDENTAL, PUNITIVE, EXEMPLARY OR
INDIRECT DAMAGES, LOST PROFITS OR OTHER BUSINESS INTERRUPTION DAMAGES, BY STATUTE, IN TORT OR CONTRACT, UNDER ANY INDEMNITY PROVISION OR OTHERWISE. THE LIMITATIONS IMPOSED ON REMEDIES AND THE MEASURE OF DAMAGES BE WITHOUT REGARD TO THE CAUSE OR CAUSES RELATED THERETO, INCLUDING THE NEGLIG
ENCE OF ANY PARTY, WHETHER
SUCH NEGLIGENCE BE SOLE, JOINT OR CONCURRENT, OR ACTIVE OR PASSIVE.
J
.
ASSIGNMENT
. Any transaction entered into that is governed by this Statement of Operating Conditions shall be binding upon and inure to the benefit of the successors, assigns,
personal representatives, and heirs of the respective Shipper and Company. No assignment of such transaction, in whole or in part, shall be made by Shipper without the prior written consent of
20 Company, which consent will not be unreasonably withheld, provided, however
, Shipper may transfer its interest to any affiliate by assignment, merger or otherwise without prior written consent
of
Company
as long as such entity has a credit status which, in Company222s sole opinion, is at least
equal to or higher than that of Shipper.
21 STATEMENT OF
OPERATING CONDITIONS
CENTANA INTRASTATE PIPELINE, LLC

:
